Varuna Seneviratna wrote:

> *I have set the classpath  to the C:\Junit\junit4.5\junit-4.5.jar
> When I try to compile MoneyTest.java from within the JunitTest Directory I
> get the below result*
> *I have saved the MoneyTest.java in a MoneyTest.java file*
> -- C:\JunitTest>javac MoneyTest.java
> .\Test.java:3: class MoneyTest is public, should be declared in a file named
> Mon
> eyTest.java
> public class MoneyTest{
>        ^
> MoneyTest.java:4: cannot access Test
> bad class file: .\Test.java
> file does not contain class Test
> Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the
> classpa
> th.
>         @Test
>          ^

What does your classpath environment variable contain (in full)?
What version of the compiler are you using (javac -version)?

You appear to be asking *java* questions rather than jUnit questions,
perhaps you need to do some research and discover your java environment
before you delve into jUnit?

For instance, if you used an IDE, then some of your 'early' questions
might answer themselves.

You might find the following link useful to read as well:-

  http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html

-- 
Mark
